author: FPS_lover

comments: My TL;DR version of my review overall: Who the f@#k wants to spend time on "Monetized Memes" A.K.A Fortnite? First off, WTF happened to the singleplayer mode? If you're going to make a game that is pretty much solely battle royale, then ditch the single player mode and stop using it for game descriptions. Second, the battle royale gameplay is boring, either on Android or PC. If it's onMy TL;DR version of my review overall: Who the f@#k wants to spend time on "Monetized Memes" A.K.A Fortnite? First off, WTF happened to the singleplayer mode? If you're going to make a game that is pretty much solely battle royale, then ditch the single player mode and stop using it for game descriptions. Second, the battle royale gameplay is boring, either on Android or PC. If it's on PC, the game rewards those who can build the fastest and who can throw the most bullets and/or explosives at their opponent. And the mobile version is abhorrent. If PUBG Mobile can have a solid framerate with decent graphics, then why is Fortnite relegated to having either 30 FPS with graphics that look like censorship in a porn game, or 15 FPS with graphics only slightly better. Granted, I don't know anything about the IOS version, and the game constantly hyped that it was optimized for IPhone X, so maybe someone will get a kick out of it, but then comes the market and the Battle Pass. The free BP has rerwards only up to level 50 out of 100 levels. Basically, the Battle Pass is saying "Thanks for playing, but if you want to have more fun You'll need to cough up at least 10 dollars." The market isn't any better, with everything there also costing at least 10 dollars, and the few things that don't cost that much, such as a 200 V-Buck emote, is locked behind either grinding the game's free battle pass for that one emote or spending at least 10 dollars. There is no amount of V-Bucks that costs less than 10 dollars. However, I will explain why I gave Fortnite a 1 instead of a 0, and that's because the console version is alright. There is slightly slower reaction speed from everyone and the game is at a manageable pace so that it is easier to not get steam rolled in the first several seconds just because someone gets some materials or weapons first. Other than that, the hype surrounding this game is utter garbage, and shows that not even thee memes that people cherish online are safe from pay-gating. And this game is from the same developer that made the excellent Infinity Blade 1 and 2? **** off.… Expand

When you find a group and enter the mission, there will always be 2 players thatThis could have been a great game, somewhat similar to Warframe. Unfortunately, they botched it. I like the concept, but they made the missions boring. Even if you complete all the objectives in the map, you still have to wait forever to finish. (timer has to run out first) Matchmaking is broken and slow. When you find a group and enter the mission, there will always be 2 players that just stand there AFK while the other 2 players do the mission for them. This is happening because of how the missions are made and the fact that you get full mission rewards for not doing anything. You can't find your own team because there is no chat in the lobby. Compare this to Warframe where you have to whisper people to find a team, this makes it much less likely for anyone to AFK. Also, in Warframe there are actually incentives in some missions to finish quickly, and i think if you die you don't get some rewards. Meanwhile in Fortnite you can die 20 times and still get full rewards. Not that you would die even 1 time while AFK because there is no threat unless you seek out enemies... I'm not able to understand why they don't fix this stuff, it's much more important than putting in new heroes and weapons... I guess selling loot boxes to fans is more important? That being said, the battle royal mode is pretty good. I would give it 7/10.… Expand

comments: Fortnite is a global phenomenon that has controlled millions of lives around the world. Yet, it's not that great. Fortnite's entire success revolves around the in-game purchases you are constantly reminded to restock on. "Hey! There's a new Fortnite skin out! I guess I'll have to spend 10 dollars on each one they add!" Since this game's target audience is on the edge of the premature, EpicFortnite is a global phenomenon that has controlled millions of lives around the world. Yet, it's not that great. Fortnite's entire success revolves around the in-game purchases you are constantly reminded to restock on. "Hey! There's a new Fortnite skin out! I guess I'll have to spend 10 dollars on each one they add!" Since this game's target audience is on the edge of the premature, Epic Games has no problem displaying their corporate greed for all the world to see. They have made billions feeding off of 5-year-olds' parents' debit cards. Fortnite's childish mechanics and graphics make everything seem innocent and harmless, and since it's free, your first impressions on Fortnite are mild. You don't really see any problem with the game. Then you discover its toxic community and desire to devour your bank account in one gulp. The reason I'm not giving this game a straight 0 is because the devs clearly put a lot of work into this game, and, this should go without saying, you need an amazing game and marketing team to make a free-to-play game the highest grossing game of all time, so huge props to the Epic Games team. But, there's one thing about Epic Games. Their workers have been in studies showing that most of them do 50, sometimes 60 to 70 hour work weeks. Fortnite's massive success has led to the hundreds of workers at Epic have depressing lives and are eternally stressed out. If there's a bug in the game, they fix it immediately: they don't milk their customers into buying the game once and then not doing anything about it, they (I can't believe I'm about to say this) care about their players. So, if you plan on playing Fortnite, be warned of this company's greed for money and not to fall into the trap of no longer being a 'lonely default skin.' This game can be fun at times, but I just lost it when they added a 'story' to Fortnite, which may be the dumbest thing that has happened to any AAA game. IT'S NOT AN RPG! 4/10 Erashor… Expand
